title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 §§ 179-4.5 - Disciplinary rules
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 §§ 179-4.5 - Disciplinary rules

State Regulations

Each behavior in this section is classified as a level I, II, or III rule violation. If a behavior has more than one designation, it may
be classified at different levels, depending upon the specific
circumstances. (01) Penal law offense. III
1.0

Commission of, or an attempt to commit, any penal law
offense is prohibited and may be referred to law enforcement agencies for
prosecution in addition to sanctions imposed by the division. (02) Fire setting and explosives. III
2.1

Residents shall not start or attempt to start a fire, except within the context of program and with staff supervision. III
2.2

Residents shall not cause or attempt to cause an
explosion. III
2.3

Residents shall not possess explosive devices or
materials which can be used to make explosive devices. (03) Assault and fighting (acts done on
purpose and not accidentally). III
3.1

Residents shall not assault, inflict or attempt to
inflict bodily harm upon another resident, a staff member or any other
person. I,II,III
3.2

Residents shall not engage in fighting or in any
violent conduct involving the threat of violence. II
3.3

Residents shall not practice or instruct others in
martial arts, sparring or self-defense techniques. I,II
3.4

Residents shall not engage in sparring, wrestling, body-punching, or other forms of horseplay. (04) Riot or inciting to riot, group or
unauthorized organization disturbance. III
4.1

Residents shall not conspire or take any action which
is intended to or results in the takeover of any area of a facility/program, or, acting in a group, engage in any violent conduct or conduct involving the
threat of violence. III
4.2

Residents shall not engage with others in any violent
conduct or conduct involving the threat of violence. II,III
4.3

Residents shall not lead, organize, participate, or
urge other residents to participate in actions which may be detrimental to the
order of the facility/program. I,II,III
4.4

Residents shall not, in conjunction with others, engage in conduct which disturbs the order of any part of the facility. This
includes but is not limited to loud talking in cafeterias, program areas or
hallways, talking after lights out, or playing of radios, televisions, tape
players or musical instruments in a loud or improper manner. III
4.5

Residents shall not engage in or encourage others to
engage in unauthorized organizational activities or meetings; display, wear, possess, distribute, or use unauthorized organizational insignia or materials. An unauthorized organization is any gang or any organization which has not been
approved by the deputy director for residential services. I,II,III
4.6

Residents shall not engage in gang-related, or
otherwise inappropriate hand, verbal, or written communication. (05) Weapons. III
5.0

Residents shall not make, possess, sell or exchange, or use any gun, firearm, ammunition; or any unauthorized use of a knife, razor, sharpened instrument, tool or other item which may be classified as a weapon in
terms of use or appearance. (06) Escape or AWOL. II,III
6.1

Residents shall not escape, attempt to escape, conspire to or be an accessory to an escape from any division facility/program
or division custody, or withhold information about an escape/AWOL. I,II,III
6.2

Residents shall not exceed the authorized time limits
of any authorized temporary absence. III
6.3

Residents shall not exceed the authorized travel
limits of any authorized temporary absence. III
6.4

Residents shall not be absent without leave (AWOL), attempt to AWOL or be an accessory to an AWOL. A resident is AWOL when (s)he
intentionally fails to return at or before the time prescribed for his/her
return. II
6.5

Residents shall comply with all conditions of their
authorized temporary absence. (07) Sex offenses. III
7.1

Residents shall not engage in, encourage, solicit or
attempt to force others to engage in sexual acts/gestures. II,III
7.2

Residents shall not intentionally expose the private
parts of their bodies. I,II,III
7.3

Physical contact between residents, including but not
limited to kissing, embracing or hand holding, is prohibited. (08) Threats, witness tampering. I,II,III
8.1

Residents shall not, under any circumstances, make
any threat (spoken, in writing or by gesture) to any person. III
8.2

Residents shall not tamper with or threaten witnesses
or informants in any investigation. (09) Bribery. III
9.0

Residents shall not bribe or extort, or attempt to
bribe or extort any person. (10) Contraband. I,II,III
10.1

Residents shall not possess any item not expressly
permitted. Any item not permitted is contraband. II,III
10.2

Residents shall not alter any permitted item so as to
change its original intent or purpose. II,III
10.3

Residents shall not possess unauthorized
security-related equipment such as keys, vehicular keys, communication devices
or restraint equipment. III
10.4

Residents shall not be in possession of any article
or paraphernalia which gives reasonable grounds to believe escape is
planned. II,III
10.5

Residents shall not make, use, possess, sell or
exchange, or be under the influence of any alcoholic beverage or intoxicant. Possession, sale or exchange of yeast or any other fermenting agent is
prohibited. II,III
10.6

Residents shall not make, use, possess, sell or
exchange, or be under the influence of any narcotic, narcotic paraphernalia, or
controlled substance. II,III
10.7

Residents shall not possess outdated or unauthorized
types or quantities of medication, nor shall they sell or exchange any
medication. I,II,III
10.8

Residents shall not be in possession of money, credit
cards, phone cards, checks or other unauthorized valuables or property. (
Note: This rule does nor apply to community-based
facilities/programs.)
I,II,III
10.9

Residents shall not be in possession of tools, culinary instruments or other items that may be considered weapons without
authorization. These items shall be used only within the context of program and
with staff supervision. I,II,III
10.10

Residents shall not possess tobacco products. I,II
10.11

Residents shall not be in possession of State issue
clothing or bedding in excess of what is allowed. The altering of State issue
clothing or bedding is prohibited. I,II,III
10.12

Residents shall not use or possess authorized items
in unauthorized areas. (11) Smuggling. II,III
11.0

Residents shall not smuggle or attempt to smuggle or
solicit others to smuggle any item into or out of the facility/program or from
one facility/program area to another. (12) Interference with staff. II,III
12.1

Residents shall not engage in any behavior (physical
or verbal) which interferes with staff in the performance of their duties, interferes with the secure and orderly operation of the facility and/or which
may result in injury to staff or residents. II,III
12.2

Residents shall not verbally obstruct staff at any
time. I,II,III
12.3

Residents shall not harass staff or any other person
verbally or in writing. I,II,III
12.4

Residents shall not direct insolent, abusive and/or
obscene language and sexual gestures to staff or any other person. I,II,III
12.5

Residents shall not commit an unhygienic act such as
spitting, urinating or defecating on the floor or any other area, or throwing
urine or feces, or in the case of female residents, throwing sanitary
items. (13) Tampering. II,III
13.0

Residents shall not alter, tamper with or attempt to
repair security devices. Residents shall not alter, rewire, tamper with or
attempt to repair electrical outlets, electrical devices, fire safety devices, safety equipment or any other device/equipment without proper
authorization. (14) Destruction or theft of
property. II,III
14.1

Residents shall not steal, misuse, destroy or
intentionally damage any property belonging to others, or possess any stolen
property. I,II,III
14.2

Residents shall not willfully destroy, steal, lose, misuse, intentionally damage or waste any type of State property. (15) Persistent pattern of
infractions. II,III
15.1

Residents who engage in a persistent pattern of
infractions and who have not responded to sanctions imposed through the
resident youth development system may be charged with a level II or level III
rule violation. II
15.2
A persistent pattern of behavior that interferes with
the program and/or with other residents' ability to participate in
program. (16) False alarms. II,III
16.0

Residents shall not set off a false fire alarm or
falsely report fires, emergencies, disturbances or other threats to
facility/program safety. (17) Failure to obey a direct order. I,II,III
17.0

Residents shall follow all direct orders from
staff. (18) Gambling. I,II
18.0

Gambling in any form is prohibited. (19) Facility counts. II,III
19.0

Residents shall cooperate fully with all
facility/program count procedures and not interfere with or otherwise disrupt
staff who are taking a count. (20) Lending, borrowing, selling, trading, buying. I,II
20.0

Residents shall not borrow, sell, lend, trade, or
purchase items for or from other residents or staff. (21) Tattooing, mutilation. I,II,III
21.0

Residents shall not tattoo or mutilate their bodies
or engage in tattooing or mutilating another person's body. Notes
